required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Remote Ischemic Conditioning Combined With Mechanical Thrombectomy for Acute Ischemic Stroke Due to Large Vessel Occlusion of Anterior Circulation: A Multicenter, Randomized, Parallel-controlled Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Remote Ischemic Conditioning Combined With Mechanical Thrombectomy for Acute Ischemic Stroke Due to Large Vessel Occlusion of Anterior Circulation: A Multicenter, Randomized, Parallel-controlled Clinical Trial
clinical_study.source: The First Hospital of Jilin University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy and safety of remote ischemic conditioning combined with mechanical thrombectomy in treating acute ischemic stroke due to large vessel occlusion of anterior circulation.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, 498 cases of ischemic stroke who undergo mechanical thrombectomy within 24 hours from the onset are included in 10 centers in China according to the principle of random, and parallel control. The experimental group receive basic treatment and remote ischemic conditioning for 200mmHg, 2 times per day for 7 consecutive days. The control group receive basic treatment and remote ischemic conditioning control for 60mmHg, 2 times per day for 7 consecutive days. Two groups will be followed up for 90 days to evaluate the efficacy and safety of remote ischemic conditioning combined with mechanical thrombectomy in treating acute ischemic stroke due to large vessel occlusion of anterior circulation.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Scale (mRS) Score 0-2
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with modified Rankin Scale (mRS) Score 0-2. Ranged from 0 to 6, a low value represents a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT.
secondary_outcome.description: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT. Ranged from 0 to 42, a low value represents a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Barthel Index (BI) at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT.
secondary_outcome.description: Barthel Index (BI) at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT. Ranged from 0 to 100, a high value represents a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: modified Rankin Scale (mRS) at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT.
secondary_outcome.description: modified Rankin Scale (mRS) at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT. Ranged from 0 to 6, a low value represents a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: The expanded Thrombolysis In Cerebral Infarction (eTICI) scale immediately after EVT
secondary_outcome.description: eTICI grade 0 is equivalent to no reperfusion or 0% filling of the downstream territory; eTICI 1 reflects thrombus reduction without any reperfusion of distal arteries; eTICI 2a is reperfusion in less than half or 1-49% of the territory; eTICI 2b50 is 50-66% reperfusion, exceeding the modified TICI (mTICI) 2B threshold but below the original TICI 2B cut-off point; eTICI 2b67 is 67-89% reperfusion, exceeding TICI but below TICI 2C; eTICI 2c is equivalent to TICI 2C or 90-99% reperfusion; and eTICI 3 is complete or 100% reperfusion, tantamount to TICI 3.

secondary_outcome.measure: Vascular recanalization rate 24 hours after EVT
secondary_outcome.description: Vascular recanalization rate 24 hours after EVT

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Hemorrhagic transformation during hospitalization
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency of Hemorrhagic transformation during hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of adverse events during follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Severe adverse events through day-90 after the onset of acute ischemic stroke.

other_outcome.measure: Numeric rating scales (NRS) score during intervention
other_outcome.description: Numeric rating scales (NRS) score during intervention. Ranged from 0 to 10, a low value represents a less pain.

other_outcome.measure: The number of early withdrawal for safety or tolerability reasons
other_outcome.description: The number of early withdrawal for safety or tolerability reasons

other_outcome.measure: Blood pressure at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT.
other_outcome.description: Blood pressure at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT.

other_outcome.measure: Heart rate at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT.
other_outcome.description: Heart rate at 24 hours, 7 days, 30±3 days, 90±3 days after EVT.

arm_group.description: RIC+Standard medical treatment Remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min reperfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 200 mm Hg. RIC will be conducted twice daily for 7 days after mechanical thrombectomy. Additionally, the patients will be treated with standard medical treatment according to the Guidelines for diagnosis and treatment of acute ischemic stroke in China 2014.

Sham RIC+Standard medical treatment Remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min reperfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 60 mm Hg. RIC will be conducted twice daily for 7 days after mechanical thrombectomy. Additionally, the patients will be treated with standard medical treatment according to the Guidelines for diagnosis and treatment of acute ischemic stroke in China 2014.

intervention.description: Remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min reperfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 200 mm Hg.

Sham remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min reperfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 60 mm Hg.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 1) Age≥18 years, regardless of sex;
- 2) Patients with a clinical diagnosis of acute ischemic stroke caused by large vessel occlusion of the anterior circulation (distal intracranial carotid artery, M1/proximal M2 or tandem lesion) cerebral artery confirmed by CTA or DSA and underwent mechanical thrombectomy;
- 3) Baseline NIHSS >= 6;
- 4) Baseline mRS ≤ 2；
- 5) Signed and dated informed consent is obtained.
Exclusion Criteria:
- 1) Patients who undergo intravenous thrombolysis;
- 2) Patients who had the contraindication of endovascular thrombectomy.
- 3) The patients who had the contraindication of remote ischemic conditioning treatment, such as severe soft tissue injury, fracture, or vascular injury in the upper limb. Acute or subacute venous thrombosis, arterial occlusive disease, subclavian steal syndrome, etc.
- 4) Head CT showed cerebral hernia and midline displacement.
- 5) Pregnant or lactating women.
- 6) Previous remote ischemic conditioning therapy or similar treatment.
- 7) Severe hepatic and renal dysfunction.
- 8) Patients with a life expectancy of less than 3 months or patients unable to complete the study for other reasons.
- 9) Unwilling to be followed up or treated for poor compliance.
- 10) He/She is participating in other clinical research or has participated in other clinical research or has participated in this study within 3 months prior to admission.
- 11) Other conditions that the researchers think are not suitable for the group.

facility.name: The First Hospital of Jilin University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: The First Hospital of Jilin University
responsible_party.investigator_title: Associated Dean of First Hospital of Jilin University
